content.description:
Stand Start, Top Out

Start standing with hands on a long right facing sidepull rail. Move up the sidepull and transition right to another sidepull rail and follow it to the top out. Between the tree and the rock behind you, you probably shouldn't fall.
content.location: On the face opposite the highway. Look for the first long vertical rail to the right of the left arete of this face.

content.description: Maybe an eliminate if you are tall. Stand start with a left condition dependent sloper and a right sloper at the bottom of the vertical rail. Use the one low foothold and figure out how to establish on the slab and layback the vertical rail to cruise to the unique lip of the boulder and topout.
content.protection: One pad works, but maybe a spotter or a second pad so you do not bounce onto the adjacent baby boulder.
content.location: This line starts in the middle of the north face of the boulder.

content.description:
Stand Start, Top Out

Start on a left facing crimp rail and a sloper at the bottom of the rail. Make your way up through the crux bottom. Cruise through better holds to the top out. Stay between the 2 opposite facing flakes for the whole route.
content.location: Between the 2 prominent flakes facing towards each other on the parking face of the Creekside Boulder.

content.description: Stand start, Top Out. Using the arete and a left facing rail to start, move up climbing the easy slab to the top out. If something ever happens to the tree, this will probably become the easiest way to get down off the top of the boulder.
content.location: Leftmost climb on the face facing away from the highway.

content.description:
Stand Start, Top Out

Start standing using 2 underclings for hands (1 is just to the left of a left facing sidepull and the other is ~1 ft left of that) and high feet. Make a big move to a prominent bulge. Get high feet again and continue straight up through increasingly good jugs to the top out.
content.location: 3 feet left of the left facing crescent shaped flake on the parking face of the Creekside Boulder.

content.description: Start on lowest holds, a pocket and an edge on the right. should be by a tree and your objective is to go up the corner of the boulder closet to the dirt road. The crux is getting your left hand on the corner pinch and getting on to the slab.
content.location: The Arete that is closet to the road

content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Start sitting with hands on 2 high jugs. One on either side of the dihedral. Use the dihedral features to make your way to a protruding left facing sidepull. Veer slightly right and up to find a good hold and then back left for a high reach to a good hold in the crack. Find your feet and continue straight up through the easy top out.
content.protection: Kind of high with an intimidating landing. A couple pads might help here.
content.location: On the highway facing face of the Creekside Boulder. This route goes up the left side of the face through the dihedral feature.

content.description:
Stand Start, Top Out

Climbs the flake. Start standing using hands on a sloper at the bottom of a left facing crescent shaped flake and find some sort of feet, probably on your right. Make a hard first move to a sidepull and then move up the flake to another sidepull and a hidden undercling. Top out over the end of the crescent.
content.location: On the parking face of the Creekside Boulder this route follows the left facing crescent shaped flake in the middle of the face.

content.description:
Stand Start, Top Out

Start standing using any of the small flakes for hands. Make your way through the larger side pulls and using holds on the arete move up and left to the good bulge. Continue through a pocket using a cool move to the top out.
content.location: Slab on the right side of the parking face of the boulder. Just to the left of the right arete.

content.description:
Stand Start, Top Out

Start standing and follow the obvious left facing flake up the slab to the top. Top out is straight up past the right angle at the top of the flake.
content.location: 10 ft left of the right arete on the parking face of the Creekside Boulder.

content.description:
A very fun and technical first move. Sit start four feet left of the arête. Use a left hand crimp and either a right hand undercling pinch, or an undercling pocket closer to the arête in order to establish (an aggressive left drop knee might help). Either lockoff or deadpoint to a U-shaped finger jug while keeping tension. Follow jugs and large crimps straight up to a mellow topout while avoiding the arête.

A stand start to this problem probably goes at around V2.
content.location: On the verticle face of the Creekside Boulder opposite of the parking area. This route goes up the right side of the face just left of the right arete.
